ğŸŒ™ In Vedic astrology, your Rasi is determined by the Moon's position at birth â€” not the Sun! 12 Rasis: Mesham (Aries/bold), Rishabam (Taurus/patient), Midhunam (Gemini/witty), Katakam (Cancer/nurturing), Simmam (Leo/confident), Kanni (Virgo/analytical), Thulam (Libra/balanced), Viruchigam (Scorpio/intense), Dhanusu (Sagittarius/optimistic), Makaram (Capricorn/disciplined), Kumbam (Aquarius/innovative), Meenam (Pisces/compassionate).

Midhunam/Thulam/Kumbam are Air signs â€” intellectual. Katakam/Viruchigam/Meenam are Water signs â€” emotional and intuitive!

â­ There are 27 Nakshatras (lunar mansions) in Vedic astrology. Your birth Nakshatra is where the Moon was at your exact birth time. It reveals your deeper character, hidden talents, and life purpose â€” more precisely than your Rasi!

âœ¨ Famous Nakshatras: Rohini (Moon's favorite â€” beauty, creativity), Pushya (most auspicious â€” nurturing, growth), Ashwini (healing, speed), Magha (authority, ancestors), Chitra (artistry). Your Nakshatra lord's placement shapes your destiny!

ğŸ”µ Saturn (Sani) is the planet of karma, discipline, hard work, and longevity. It rules Capricorn and Aquarius. Saturn rewards patience and punishes shortcuts. Its 19-year Mahadasha is a period of building solid foundations through perseverance!

âš–ï¸ Sade Sati is Saturn's 7.5-year transit over your Rasi â€” it tests you deeply but also purifies and strengthens. Remedies: worship Shani on Saturdays, donate sesame oil and black cloth, chant Om Shanishcharaya Namah 108 times, and feed crows!

ğŸª Saturn placed strongly in your chart (in Libra/exalted, or in Capricorn/Aquarius) gives tremendous discipline, authority, and long-term success. A weak Saturn causes delays, health issues, and karma-related challenges. Check your Birth Chart page!

ğŸŸ¡ Jupiter (Guru/Brihaspati) is the most benefic planet â€” the great teacher! It rules Sagittarius and Pisces, and is exalted in Cancer. Jupiter governs wisdom, wealth, children, spirituality, and marriage. A strong Jupiter is the single biggest blessing in any chart!

âœ¨ Jupiter Mahadasha (16 years) is generally the most auspicious period â€” bringing education, wealth, marriage, children, and spiritual growth. Jupiter's transit over your 7th house often brings marriage; over the 2nd/11th house brings financial gains!

ğŸ™ To strengthen Jupiter: worship on Thursdays, wear Yellow Sapphire (after consulting an astrologer), chant Om Guruve Namah, donate yellow items, feed Brahmins. Jupiter's blessings bring prosperity, wisdom, and divine grace!

ğŸŸ£ Rahu is the north lunar node â€” it represents obsession, ambition, foreign connections, technology, and sudden events. Rahu amplifies whatever it touches. Its 18-year Mahadasha brings dramatic life changes, foreign opportunities, and material success through unconventional paths!

âš« Ketu is the south lunar node â€” representing spirituality, detachment, past-life karma, and liberation. Ketu gives sudden losses but deep spiritual insight. Its 7-year Mahadasha is transformative â€” perfect for spiritual growth, research, and inner discovery!
